page.title: 08THE ASPARAGUS FIELDS
page.content: ASPARAGUS HAS BEEN AN IMPORTANT CROP IN THIS AREA SINCE THE EIGHTEENTH CENTURY. IT IS GROWN IN FIELDS CLEARED FROM THE FIXED DUNES. IT IS FOUR YEARS BEFORE THE FIRST CROP IS HARVESTED AND AFTER FIFTEEN YEARS IT IS NECESSARY TO REST THE LAND AND MOVE TO ANOTHER AREA. ONE OF THE OLD ASPARAGUS FIELDS IS NOW A CARAVAN SITE AND ANOTHER WAS USED AS A NICOTINE WASTE DUMP BY A LOCAL TOBACCO MANUFACTURE. THIS LATTER AREA IS VERY FERTILE AND IS COVERED BY NETTLES, PROVIDING A RICH HABITAT FOR STINGING NETTLES.
